content:
Write a janus custom element called `weather-metar`. It exposes an async function, getWeather(), which takes GPS coordinates to get the closest METAR report from the FAA / NOAA. Note that you may have to use other services to look up, eg, closest weather station from GPS, use your discretion.

Store the current METAR data in an object containing all the properties using standardized METAR names for properties like visibility, weather type, ceiling, winds aloft, time the reading was made, etc. This object will be returned asynchronously from our getWeather() function.

Implemented the `weather-metar` custom element with an asynchronous `getWeather()` function that retrieves the closest METAR report based on provided GPS coordinates. The METAR data is stored in a standardized object containing properties like visibility, weather type, ceiling, winds aloft, and the time the reading was made.

No additional suggestions at this time. Please let me know if you have a preferred METAR data source or any specific requirements for the data handling.

```javascript
